archetypes.name: Family AirFryer Weeknight Wins
archetypes.description: Ultra-fast, kid-friendly family dinners centered on the air fryer—crispy mains and veg sides with minimal prep for busy weeknights.
archetypes.rationale: Adds a high-demand, not-yet-covered family archetype focused on AirFryer speed and kid-safe heat levels for weeknight convenience.

meals.name: Air Fryer Hake Nugget Taco Bowls
meals.description: Crispy hake nuggets over quick rice with slaw, corn, and mild salsa—family-friendly and ready in minutes using the air fryer and microwave.
prep_steps: Preheat air fryer to 200°C/390°F for 3 minutes.
Set out 4 bowls.
Cut lemon into wedges.
Open slaw and salsa; set aside with a spoon.
Open rice packs so they are ready to heat.
Drain corn if needed.
cook_steps: Air fry hake nuggets in a single layer for 8–10 minutes, shaking halfway, until crisp and hot.
Microwave rice per pack directions (about 2 minutes per pack) until steaming.
Fluff rice and divide among 4 bowls.
Top each bowl with a handful of slaw and a scoop of corn.
Add crispy hake nuggets to each bowl.
Spoon salsa over the top.
Serve with lemon wedges; drizzle aioli if desired.

meals.name: Air Fryer Meatball Melt Subs & Green Beans
meals.description: Crispy air-fried beef meatballs stuffed into toasted ciabatta with warm tomato sauce and melty mozzarella, plus quick garlicky green beans. A fast, kid-friendly weeknight combo.
prep_steps: Preheat air fryer to 200°C/400°F for 3 minutes.
Split 4 ciabatta rolls lengthwise.
Shred or slice mozzarella cheese if needed.
Toss green beans with olive oil, garlic and herb seasoning, and a pinch of salt.
Place tomato pasta sauce in a microwave-safe bowl.
cook_steps: Air fry beef meatballs in the basket for 6–8 minutes, shaking halfway, until browned and heated through.
Air fry the seasoned green beans in the basket (or on a lined tray) for 6–8 minutes until crisp-tender; shake once.
Microwave tomato pasta sauce for 60–90 seconds until hot; stir.
Lightly air fry the split ciabatta rolls, cut side up, for 1–2 minutes to warm.
Assemble subs: place meatballs on rolls, spoon over tomato pasta sauce, and top with mozzarella cheese.
Return assembled subs to the air fryer for 1–2 minutes until cheese melts.
Serve subs with the green beans on the side.

meals.name: BBQ Chicken Strip Wraps with Slaw & Corn
meals.description: Fast, kid‑friendly BBQ chicken wraps using the air fryer with crunchy slaw and sweet corn. Minimal prep and quick assembly for weeknights.
prep_steps: Preheat air fryer to 200°C/390°F.
Set out 8 tortilla wraps on a board or plate.
Place slaw in a bowl and have barbecue sauce ready.
Rinse and drain corn; pat dry with a paper towel.
Have a microwave-safe plate ready for warming wraps.
cook_steps: Air-fry chicken strips in a single layer for 6–8 minutes until hot and crisp, shaking halfway.
Microwave tortilla wraps (stacked and covered with a damp paper towel) for 20–30 seconds to soften.
Assemble wraps: add a handful of slaw, a few chicken strips, and spoonfuls of corn to each wrap.
Drizzle barbecue sauce over the filling.
Roll and serve immediately; add extra sauce on the side if desired.

archetypes.name: Family Weeknight Classics (SA & US)
archetypes.description: Kid-friendly, crowd-pleasing dinners with familiar South African and American flavors, built for quick weeknights.
archetypes.rationale: Establishes a mainstream, high-appeal family weeknight baseline (simple, 15–30 min, mild heat) across South African and American comfort cuisines to anchor broad coverage early.

meals.name: BBQ Beef Sloppy Joes with Chakalaka
meals.description: Family-friendly sloppy joes with a sweet-mild BBQ filling, served on soft burger buns with a South African chakalaka topper.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 180°C/350°F to warm the buns.
Finely chop 1 onion.
Dice 1 bell pepper.
Peel and mince 2 cloves garlic.
Open the chakalaka can/jar.
cook_steps: Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat.
Add onion and bell pepper; cook 3–4 minutes until softened.
Add beef mince; cook 5–7 minutes, breaking it up, until browned. Spoon off excess fat if needed.
Stir in garlic; cook 30 seconds.
Add barbecue sauce and tomato paste with a splash of water; stir to coat. Simmer 3–4 minutes until thick and glossy.
Season with salt and pepper to taste; lower heat to keep warm.
Warm burger buns in the oven for 3–5 minutes until soft and toasty.
Split buns, pile the BBQ beef onto the bottoms.
Spoon chakalaka over the meat or serve on the side.
Top with bun lids and serve.

meals.name: Boerewors Dogs with Chakalaka and Oven Wedges
meals.description: Pan-seared boerewors tucked into hot dog buns with a chakalaka-onion relish and crispy oven potato wedges. A quick South African–American family favorite.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C/425°F.
Line a baking tray with baking paper.
Spread potato wedges on the tray.
Peel and thinly slice the onion.
Split hot dog buns lengthwise (not all the way through).
Open the chakalaka can/jar and stir.
cook_steps: Bake potato wedges for 20–25 minutes until golden, turning once halfway.
Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat.
Add boerewors and cook 12–15 minutes, turning often, until browned and cooked through (165°F/74°C).
In the last 2 minutes of baking, warm the hot dog buns on the oven rack.
In a small bowl, mix sliced onion with chakalaka to make a quick relish.
Cut boerewors into 4 bun-length pieces.
Assemble: place boerewors in buns, top with chakalaka-onion relish, and add ketchup and mustard to taste.
Serve with the oven wedges.

meals.name: 15-Min Teriyaki Chicken Udon Stir-Fry
meals.description: Family-friendly teriyaki chicken tossed with springy udon and mixed veggies. Mild, glossy sauce and quick stovetop cooking for a weeknight win.
prep_steps: Slice chicken thigh fillets into thin strips.
Mince garlic and slice spring onion.
Open the bag of stir-fry vegetables.
Bring a pot of water to a boil for udon noodles (or microwave-ready packs to loosen, 1 minute).
Measure teriyaki sauce, soy sauce, and sesame oil.
cook_steps: Boil udon noodles until just tender (about 3–4 minutes). Drain and set aside.
Heat peanut oil in a large pan or wok over high heat.
Add chicken strips and black pepper (optional). Stir-fry until lightly browned and cooked through, 4–5 minutes.
Add garlic and half the spring onion. Stir-fry 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add stir-fry vegetables. Toss on high heat for 2–3 minutes until crisp-tender.
Add drained udon noodles. Pour in teriyaki sauce and soy sauce. Toss for 1–2 minutes until glossy and coated.
Turn off heat. Drizzle sesame oil and toss.
Top with remaining spring onion and sesame seeds. Serve hot.

meals.name: 12-Minute Beef & Broccoli Ramen Stir-Fry
meals.description: Quick, mild noodle stir-fry with tender beef, broccoli, and a glossy soy–oyster sauce. Family-friendly and fast for busy weeknights.
prep_steps: Thinly slice the beef sirloin steak against the grain.
Cut broccoli into small bite-size florets if needed; slice spring onion; mince garlic.
In a bowl, whisk soy sauce, oyster sauce, rice vinegar, brown sugar, bone broth, and cornflour until smooth.
Bring a pot of water to a boil for the ramen noodles.
cook_steps: Boil ramen noodles until just tender (about 2–3 minutes); drain and set aside.
Heat canola oil in a large pan or wok over high heat.
Stir-fry beef in a single layer until just browned (1–2 minutes).
Add garlic and spring onion; toss for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add broccoli and stir-fry vegetables; cook 2–3 minutes until crisp-tender.
Stir the sauce and pour into the pan; simmer 30–60 seconds until glossy.
Add cooked ramen noodles; toss to coat. Drizzle sesame oil, toss, and serve.

archetypes.rationale: Adds a Hot-leaning, OutdoorGrill-focused Caribbean option for families—filling gaps in cuisine, heat, and equipment not covered by existing weeknight and oven/slow-cooker archetypes.

meals.name: Habanero Jerk Chicken with Pineapple Peppers and Coconut Rice
meals.description: Grilled butterflied chicken in a hot Caribbean jerk marinade, served with charred pineapple and peppers plus creamy coconut basmati rice and a crisp lime-vinegar slaw.
prep_steps: Preheat Outdoor Grill to medium-high (200–230°C).
Finely chop habanero peppers, spring onion, onions, and garlic.
Zest and juice limes.
In a bowl, mix habanero peppers, spring onion, onions, garlic, thyme, allspice, black pepper, salt, brown sugar, apple cider vinegar, lime zest and juice, and sunflower oil to make a paste.
Pat dry butterflied chicken; rub all over with the jerk paste. Marinate 20–30 minutes while you prep sides.
Cut pineapple into spears and bell peppers into chunky pieces; toss with a little sunflower oil and a pinch of salt.
Rinse basmati rice until water runs clear; drain.
Shred cabbage and grate carrots. In a bowl, combine cabbage, carrots, apple cider vinegar, lime juice, sugar, a pinch of salt, and black pepper. Toss and set aside.
cook_steps: Coconut rice: In a saucepan, add basmati rice, coconut milk, vegetable stock, bay leaves, and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then reduce to low, cover, and simmer 12–15 minutes until liquid is absorbed. Rest 5 minutes off heat; fluff and remove bay leaves.

Grill chicken: Place butterflied chicken skin-side up over indirect heat. Close lid and grill 25–30 minutes, then move over medium direct heat to crisp skin, 5–8 minutes more, turning as needed until juices run clear and internal temp reaches 75°C at the thickest part.
Grill pineapple and peppers: While chicken finishes, grill pineapple spears and bell peppers over direct heat, 6–8 minutes, turning until lightly charred and tender.
Rest chicken 5–10 minutes, then carve into portions.
Plate coconut rice, add grilled pineapple and peppers, and serve with the lime-vinegar slaw.

meals.name: Tandoori-Style Chicken with Jeera Rice and Quick Raita
meals.description: Oven-roasted yogurt-marinated chicken thighs with cumin-scented basmati rice and a cool cucumber-mint raita. Family-friendly with adjustable mild-to-medium heat.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C (430°F). Line a baking tray.
In a bowl, mix yoghurt, lemon juice, garlic (minced), garam masala, chilli powder, and salt for the marinade.
Pat dry chicken thigh fillets and cut large pieces into even sizes.
Measure basmati rice and vegetable stock.
Slice cucumber finely and chop mint.
Set out garlic naan bread, ready to warm.
cook_steps: Toss chicken thigh fillets in the marinade until coated; rest 10 minutes.
Place chicken on the lined tray, drizzle with canola oil, and roast 20–25 minutes, turning once, until cooked through and lightly charred at the edges.
While chicken roasts, heat ghee in a pot over medium heat; add cumin seeds and bay leaves, toast 30 seconds until fragrant.

Add basmati rice; stir to coat 1 minute. Pour in vegetable stock, add a pinch of salt, bring to a boil, then reduce to low, cover, and cook 12–15 minutes until stock is absorbed. Rest 5 minutes off heat.
For raita: combine yoghurt, cucumber, mint, and a pinch of salt in a small bowl.
Warm garlic naan bread on the oven rack for the last 3–4 minutes of chicken roasting.
Fluff rice with a fork. Serve chicken over jeera rice with raita on the side and warm naan.

meals.name: Family Chicken Dum Biryani (Stovetop-to-Oven)
meals.description: Layered chicken and basmati rice biryani finished in the oven for a gentle dum, with aromatic whole spices and a mild-to-medium heat. Family-friendly and from-scratch.
prep_steps: Rinse 2 cups basmati rice until water runs clear; soak 20 minutes, then drain.
Slice 2 large onions thinly.
Chop 2 large tomatoes.
Finely mince 4 cloves garlic.
In a bowl, mix 1 cup yoghurt, 2 tsp garam masala, 1 tsp ground cumin, 1 tsp turmeric powder, 0.5 tsp chilli powder (optional), 1 tsp salt, and half the minced garlic.
Cut 800 g chicken thigh fillets into large chunks; coat in the yoghurt marinade and rest 15 minutes.
Warm 2 tbsp milk and crumble a pinch of saffron into it; set aside.
Roughly chop a small bunch of coriander and a small bunch of mint; cut 1 lemon into wedges.
Preheat oven to 180°C/350°F.
cook_steps: Heat 3 tbsp ghee in a large oven-safe pot over medium heat on the stove.
Add 2 bay leaves, 1 cinnamon stick, and 4 cloves; sizzle 30 seconds.
Add sliced onions with a pinch of salt; cook 10–12 minutes until deep golden, stirring often. Reserve 1/3 of the onions for topping.
Add remaining minced garlic; cook 30 seconds.
Add marinated chicken; spread in an even layer. Sear 3–4 minutes per side until lightly browned.
Stir in chopped tomatoes and cook 3–4 minutes until they soften and release juices.
Layer drained basmati rice evenly over the chicken (do not stir).
Pour 2.5 cups chicken stock around the pot edges to avoid disturbing layers. Drizzle the saffron milk over the rice.
Top with reserved fried onions and half the chopped coriander and mint.
Cover tightly with a lid (or foil under the lid for a tight seal).
Bake at 180°C/350°F for 20–25 minutes until rice is tender and liquid absorbed.
Rest covered 10 minutes out of the oven. Fluff gently from the sides, mixing some rice with chicken but keeping layers.
Finish with remaining coriander and mint. Serve with lemon wedges.

archetypes.name: Family Middle Eastern & Greek Mezze Nights
archetypes.description: Build-it-yourself family dinners with shawarma-style meats or veggie trays, herby rice, and simple dips for mix-and-match plates.
archetypes.rationale: Complements the existing SA/US weeknight mild set by offering a medium-heat, from-scratch family option in Middle Eastern/Greek flavors with a longer 30–60 minute window and intermediate assembly-style workflow.

meals.name: Sheet-Pan Shawarma Chicken with Lemon Rice and Mint Yogurt
meals.description: Family-style shawarma chicken and peppers roasted on a tray, served with lemon basmati rice and a quick mint yogurt. Build plates with warm pita and a sprinkle of sumac.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C/425°F.
Rinse 1 1/2 cups basmati rice until water runs clear; drain.
Slice 700–800 g chicken thigh fillets into strips.
Slice 2 bell peppers into strips and 1 red onion into wedges.
Finely chop 2 cloves garlic and a small handful of mint.
Zest and juice 1 lemon; keep separate.
Grate 1/2 cucumber on large holes; squeeze out excess liquid.
Warm pita bread in packaging or cover to keep ready.
cook_steps: On a large tray, toss chicken thigh fillets, bell peppers, and red onion with olive oil, shawarma paste, half the lemon juice, sea salt, and black pepper. Spread in a single layer.
Roast on the middle rack for 20–25 minutes, stirring once, until chicken is cooked through and edges are browned.

While the tray roasts, add basmati rice to a saucepan with 2 1/4 cups water, a pinch of sea salt, and a drizzle of olive oil. Bring to a boil, then cover and simmer on low 12 minutes. Remove from heat and rest 5 minutes, covered.
In a bowl, mix yogurt, grated cucumber, chopped mint, garlic, remaining lemon juice, and a pinch of sea salt and black pepper to make mint yogurt.
Fluff rice with a fork; stir in lemon zest and a little olive oil. Adjust sea salt to taste.
Warm pita bread in the oven for 2–3 minutes during the last minutes of roasting.
To serve: spoon lemon rice onto plates, top with shawarma chicken and vegetables, dollop mint yogurt, and finish with a sprinkle of sumac. Serve pita on the side.

archetypes.name: Family North African Tagine & Couscous Nights
archetypes.description: Family-sized Moroccan/Algerian/Tunisian-inspired dinners—tagines, chermoula-roasted fish or veg, and couscous/bean sides—with balanced, kid-manageable warmth and approachable steps.
archetypes.rationale: Adds missing North African family coverage with 30–60 minute, mild-to-medium meals that complement existing Mediterranean/Middle Eastern sets without overlap.

meals.name: Chicken, Apricot & Chickpea Tagine with Couscous
meals.description: A family-friendly North African braise of chicken, sweet apricots, and chickpeas, finished with preserved lemon and herbs, served over fluffy couscous.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 180°C/350°F.
Slice 2 onions and mince 3 garlic cloves.
Peel and cut 3 carrots into chunky rounds.
Rinse and drain 2 cups cooked chickpeas if using canned.
Chop 6 apricots and finely chop the rind of 1 preserved lemon.
Roughly chop a small handful of parsley.
Pat dry 1 kg chicken thighs; season all sides with 1.5 tsp salt and 1 tsp black pepper.
In a jug, whisk 1 cup passata with 1.5 cups chicken stock and 1 tbsp tomato paste.
cook_steps: Heat 2 tbsp olive oil in a large oven-safe pot over medium-high heat.
Brown chicken thighs in batches, 3–4 minutes per side; set aside.
Lower heat to medium. Add onions and a pinch of salt; cook 5 minutes until translucent.
Stir in garlic, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp coriander, 1 tsp paprika, 1/2 tsp cinnamon, 1/2 tsp turmeric powder; cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add carrots, chickpeas, apricots, preserved lemon, and 1 bay leaf; toss to coat.
Return chicken and any juices to the pot. Pour in the passata-stock mixture. Bring to a simmer.
Cover and transfer to the oven; bake 25–30 minutes until chicken is tender and sauce slightly thickened.
While the tagine finishes, put 2 cups couscous in a bowl. Bring 2 cups vegetable stock to a boil; pour over couscous, cover, and rest 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork.
Taste the tagine; adjust salt and black pepper to preference. Remove bay leaf.
Sprinkle with chopped parsley and serve the tagine over couscous.

meals.name: Chermoula Tilapia with Tomato-Olive Brown Rice
meals.description: Baked tilapia in bright chermoula served over spiced brown basmati rice with tomatoes and olives, plus quick green beans on the side.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 200°C (390°F).
Rinse 1.5 cups brown basmati rice until water runs clear; drain well.
Finely chop 1 medium onion.
Dice 3 medium tomatoes.
Roughly chop 1/2 cup olives.
Mince 2 cloves garlic.
Trim 300 g green beans.
Chop a small handful of parsley.
Pat dry 4 tilapia fillets; season both sides lightly with salt and black pepper.
Zest then halve 1 lemon.
cook_steps: Start rice: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a medium pot over medium heat. Add chopped onion and cook 3–4 minutes until translucent.
Stir in 1 teaspoon cumin and 1 teaspoon paprika for 30 seconds. Add rinsed rice and toast 1 minute.
Pour in 3 cups vegetable stock and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Bring to a boil, then reduce to low, cover, and simmer 30–35 minutes until tender.

Bake fish: In a small bowl, mix 2 tablespoons chermoula with 1 tablespoon olive oil and the juice of half the lemon. Brush over tilapia on a lined tray. Bake 10–12 minutes until the fish flakes easily.

Green beans: While fish bakes, heat 1 teaspoon olive oil in a skillet over medium-high. Add green beans and a pinch of salt; cook 4–5 minutes until crisp-tender, tossing once. Add half the minced garlic in the last 30 seconds; toss and remove from heat.
Finish rice: In the last 5 minutes of rice cooking, fold in diced tomatoes and chopped olives. Cover to warm through.
Fluff rice with a fork. Stir in lemon zest and chopped parsley; adjust salt and black pepper to taste.
Serve rice in bowls, top with baked tilapia. Spoon any tray juices over the fish. Serve green beans on the side with remaining lemon wedges.

archetypes.name: Family Set-and-Forget Slow Cooker (Mexican & Latin American)
archetypes.description: Hands-off slow cooker family dinners with Mexican and broader Latin American flavors—taco-ready shredded meats/beans, stews, and rice-friendly dishes that cook low and slow while you get on with your day.
archetypes.rationale: This fills the uncovered family-friendly, hands-off 60+ minute Simple slot with kid-approachable Mild heat and non-overlapping Mexican/Latin American flavors for easy weeknight batch cooking.

meals.name: Slow Cooker Pork Carnitas Tacos (Mild)
meals.description: Hands-off, citrus-scented shredded pork finished with a quick skillet crisp for tender, taco-ready carnitas. Mild and family-friendly.
prep_steps: Trim excess fat from the pork shoulder and cut into 3–4 large chunks.
Peel and thickly slice the onions.
Peel and lightly smash the garlic.
Juice the orange and lime into a small bowl.
Measure ground cumin, oregano, salt, and black pepper.
cook_steps: Add the sliced onions and smashed garlic to the slow cooker as a base.
Place pork shoulder chunks on top. Sprinkle ground cumin, oregano, salt, and black pepper over the pork.
Pour in the orange juice and lime juice. Tuck in the bay leaves.
Cover and cook on Low for 8–10 hours (or High for 4–5 hours) until the pork is very tender.
Transfer pork to a tray, discard bay leaves, and shred the meat with two forks. Skim fat from the cooking juices.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat on the stovetop. Add olive oil.
Spread a layer of shredded pork in the hot skillet; spoon over a little of the cooking juices. Cook 3–5 minutes without stirring to crisp edges, then toss once. Repeat with remaining pork.
Warm tortillas on a dry skillet 30–60 seconds per side until pliable.
Serve pork in warm tortillas with salsa, sliced avocado, and shredded lettuce.

Cover and cook on Low for 8–10 hours (or High for 4–5 hours) until the pork is very tender.
Transfer pork to a tray, discard bay leaves, and shred the meat with two forks. Skim fat from the cooking juices.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat on the stovetop. Add olive oil.
Spread a layer of shredded pork in the hot skillet; spoon over a little of the cooking juices. Cook 3–5 minutes without stirring to crisp edges, then toss once. Repeat with remaining pork.
Warm tortillas on a dry skillet 30–60 seconds per side until pliable.
Serve pork in warm tortillas with salsa, sliced avocado, and shredded lettuce.

archetypes.name: Family Mediterranean Oven Bakes (Italian/Spanish/Portuguese)
archetypes.description: Hands-off, family-sized oven bakes and sheet-pan dinners with Italian, Spanish, and Portuguese flavors—think pasta bakes, roasted chicken-and-potato trays, and veggie-forward casseroles for crowd-pleasing weeknights.
archetypes.rationale: Adds a mainstream, kid-friendly Mediterranean oven-bake format not covered by existing archetypes, expanding European cuisine variety with simple, hands-off family dinners.

meals.name: Baked Orzo with Chorizo, Peppers, and Mozzarella
meals.description: Family-friendly Italian–Spanish oven bake where orzo cooks in a tomato sauce with chorizo and peppers, finished bubbly with mozzarella and parmesan.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 200°C (390°F).
Dice onion and finely chop garlic.
Slice bell peppers into strips.
Cut chorizo into bite-size pieces.
Measure orzo, passata, and chicken stock.
Grate parmesan and tear or slice mozzarella.
cook_steps: Heat a large oven-safe dish on the stovetop over medium heat with olive oil.
Add chorizo and onion; cook 3–4 minutes until chorizo renders and onion softens.
Stir in garlic and bell peppers; cook 1 minute to soften slightly.
Turn off heat. Stir in orzo, passata, chicken stock, oregano, a pinch of sea salt, and pepper; level the mixture.
Cover tightly with foil and bake 20 minutes.
Uncover, stir, and check orzo doneness; bake uncovered 5–10 minutes more until orzo is tender and sauce thickened.
Top with mozzarella and parmesan; bake 5 minutes until cheese melts and bubbles.
Rest 5 minutes, then taste and adjust sea salt and pepper. Serve hot.

meals.name: Spanish-Portuguese Chicken and Potato Tray Bake
meals.description: Family-sized roasted chicken thighs with potatoes, peppers, and a mild paprika-tomato glaze. Hands-off oven bake with bright lemon and herbs.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C (425°F).
Scrub and cut potatoes into 2–3 cm chunks.
Slice bell peppers into strips and onion into wedges.
Finely chop garlic.
Zest and halve the lemon; chop parsley.
Set out a large rimmed baking tray.
cook_steps: Warm a small pan over medium heat (StoveTop). Add olive oil, garlic, paprika, oregano, and tomato and onion mix; stir 2–3 minutes until fragrant, then remove from heat.
On the baking tray, toss potatoes, bell peppers, and onion with half the warm paprika-tomato oil and a big pinch of sea salt and pepper. Spread in an even layer.
Nestle chicken thighs skin-side up on top. Brush or spoon the remaining paprika-tomato oil over the chicken. Add lemon halves (cut-side up) to the tray.
Roast on the middle rack for 40–45 minutes, until chicken skin is crisp, juices run clear, and potatoes are tender (internal temp 75°C/167°F).
Squeeze roasted lemon over the tray, scatter parsley and lemon zest, and adjust sea salt and pepper to taste.
Rest 5 minutes, then serve straight from the tray.

archetypes.name: Family Thai & Vietnamese Quick Bowls
archetypes.description: 15–30 minute family dinners with Thai and Vietnamese flavors—stir-fried rice noodles, lemongrass meats or tofu, herby rice bowls, and speedy pho‑style soups with kid‑adjustable toppings.
archetypes.rationale: Adds a mainstream family weeknight option covering Southeast Asian (Thai/Vietnamese) flavors with mild-to-medium heat and quick, simple builds not yet represented by existing folders.

meals.name: Lemongrass Chicken Vermicelli Bowls
meals.description: Vietnamese-style rice vermicelli bowls with seared lemongrass chicken, crisp veggies, and a lime–fish sauce dressing. Heat is kid-adjustable with optional chilies.
prep_steps: Slice chicken steaks into thin strips.
Trim and finely mince lemongrass and garlic.
Julienne carrots and cucumber.
Shred lettuce.
Roughly chop mint and coriander; slice spring onion.
Halve lime; finely slice chilies (optional).
Bring a pot of water to a boil on the stovetop for rice vermicelli.
cook_steps: In a bowl, toss chicken with lemongrass, half the garlic, 1 tsp sugar, a pinch of salt, and 1 tbsp sunflower oil. Set aside 5 minutes.
Cook rice vermicelli in boiling water until just tender (per pack timing, usually 3–4 minutes). Drain and rinse under cold water to stop cooking. Set aside.
Make dressing: in a small bowl, mix fish sauce, remaining garlic, juice of 1 lime, 2 tsp sugar, and a few chili slices if using.
Heat 1 tbsp sunflower oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Sear marinated chicken in a single layer until browned and cooked through, 4–6 minutes.
Optional: If noodles have cooled, microwave briefly (30–45 seconds) to warm.
Assemble bowls: add a bed of rice vermicelli, top with lettuce, carrots, cucumber, warm chicken, mint, coriander, and spring onion.
Spoon dressing over each bowl to taste. Serve extra chilies and lime on the side.

meals.name: Family Pho-Style Beef Rice Noodle Soup
meals.description: Speedy Vietnamese-style beef noodle soup with a fragrant broth and kid-adjustable toppings. Pour the hot broth over thin-sliced steak so it cooks in the bowl.
prep_steps: Thinly slice beef sirloin steak across the grain.
Peel and thinly slice onion.
Rinse and pick basil, mint, and coriander leaves; slice spring onion.
Cut lime into wedges.
Set out sriracha for optional heat.
cook_steps: Add beef stock to a large pot and bring to a boil over high heat.
Add onion, cinnamon, star anise, cloves, fish sauce, and sugar. Reduce heat and simmer 10 minutes for fragrance.
Add rice noodles to the pot and cook until just tender (3–4 minutes).
Use tongs to divide noodles into 4 bowls. Strain or ladle the hot broth over the noodles, leaving whole spices in the pot.
Top each bowl with raw thin-sliced beef; immediately ladle extra boiling broth over the beef so it cooks through.
Garnish with basil, mint, coriander, and spring onion. Serve with lime wedges and sriracha on the side.
